page.title: 08ST PETER'S CHURCH RODMARTON
page.content: St Peter's Church has been in Rodmarton since about 1086. It is mainly Norman. Inside the church there is a font where a baby is christened. There are stained glass windows of red and green. Many crosses can be seen inside and outside of the church, they are to remind us that Jesus died for us. The organ is an electronic one. Bells are in the Belfry. There is a brass lectern and the pulpit is constructed of oak found in the church.In the church yard there are many graves. A war cross shows the number of Rodmarton men who lost their lives in the first world war. No man in Rodmarton lost their life in the second world war although 20 did serve There are 4 services a week. During the last 5 years there have been 6 marriages, 2 confirmations and 20 burial services.
